CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Union, with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01C02

TITLE.P: The Polesworth School and The Wilnecote School — Tender for Cleaning Services

SHORT_DESCR.P: The successful Supplier will be required to provide cleaning services at the following locations:
— the Polesworth School, Dordon Road, Dordon, Tamworth, Staffordshire, B78 1QT (http://thepolesworthschool.com/),
— the Wilnecote School, Tinkers Green Road, Wilnecote, Tamworth, Staffordshire, B77 5LF (https://www.thewilnecoteschool.com/).
The Polesworth School is the lead school and founder of the Community Academies Trust and in March 2016 were designated as a National Teaching School.
The Winecote School joined the Community Academies Trust in 2017 and has seen major positive improvements over the past year regarding academic achievements.

MAIN_SITE.P: The Polesworth School and The Wilnecote School, Tamworth, Staffordshire, United Kingdom.

SHORT_DESCR.P: The cleaning services provision at both schools has not been market tested in recent years and to ensure Best Value principles are applied the Headteachers and School / Sponsors / Governors of each school have made a decision to tender their cleaning services.
Current student roll numbers across both sites are approximately 2 283:
— the Polesworth School: 1 556 students and 215 teaching and support staff,
— the Wilnecote School: 727 students and 100 teaching and support staff.
The current contract value for both schools is approximately 270 000 GBP per annum.

The cleaning staff at The Polesworth School are currently employed by the school direct; the cleaning team at The Wilnecote School are employed by the incumbent contractor, Entrust. For the avoidance of doubt TUPE Regulations, including pension rights will apply to this contract.

Both schools are seeking both innovation and the application of current initiatives within the cleaning industry within the tender submissions and would expect as a result of this to be able to identify “Best Value” and work in partnership with the chosen Supplier going forward.
Each school has set its own set of objectives regarding the outcome of the tender process:
The Polesworth School:
— seek to modify work patterns to improve and maximise productivity,
— to maintain perceived current high standards of cleaning on a day-to-day basis, with possibility of improvement,
— to ensure that there is a clear structure to deep clean and holiday clean,
— to modify and improve work practice, particularly as regards equipment and chemicals, ensuring that skills training is regular and ongoing throughout the contract term.
The Wilnecote School:
— reduction in operational costs, if possible,
— increase in the regularity of classroom cleans, which has been restricted on the basis of cost,
— improvement of quality of products and equipment used to deliver the operational standards expected,
— introduction of new and innovative equipment.
The contract being tendered is for 3 years in duration with the possibility of extending for a further 2 years depending on service deliverability. The contract will commence on 1.11.2018.

The contract will be fixed price with the Supplier invoicing the client for one-twelfth of the annual cost on a monthly basis. Any variations to the contract that are requested by the Client should be invoiced at the agreed rate and should be calculated on an hourly rate per employee needed to carry out the variation to the satisfaction of the Client.

Whilst the monthly charge will represent one-twelfth of the contract cost, a reconciliation will take place monthly to reconcile the actual hours worked within the contract. If the hours worked are less than those budgeted for a credit will be required by each school. The Client expects that the tendered amount of hours are worked at all times and the successful Supplier is expected to have a system in place to cover for both planned and unplanned leave.

The basis and rationale of the Client requires the successful Supplier to operate at all times in providing a clean environment that is fit for purpose and that the Supplier is proactive in the management of the contract, thus ensuring that all specifications are achieved as detailed within the tender specification.
Note: To ensure Best Value and economies of scale this contract will be awarded as a single lot.

CRITERIA_CANDIDATE.P: A minimum of 5 suppliers and a maximum of 10 suppliers will be taken forward to the tender stage of the process. Where less than 5 suppliers meet the minimum standards, only those that meet the minimum standards will be taken through to the tender stage. Where more than 5 suppliers meet the minimum standard, those suppliers with the highest scores will proceed to the tender stage.

INFO_ADD.P: Interest in the selection process should be expressed via email only to pqq@litmuspartnership.co.uk clearly stating within this email which contract / notice you are referring to. Please also provide, as a minimum, a contact name, full company postal address and telephone number.
The Selection Questionnaire and associated documents can be obtained at: http://www.litmuspartnership.co.uk/project/the_polesworth_school_and_the_wilnecote_school

The closing date for receipt of the Selection Questionnaire is 11.5.2018 (12:00). Suppliers are required to ensure that documents are obtained and returned to The Litmus Partnership Limited, by email to pqq@litmuspartnership.co.uk by the above closing date and time.

Documents in respect of economic / financial standing (where indicated in the Selection Questionnaire) shall be returned to The Litmus Partnership Limited, by email to pqq@litmuspartnership.co.uk by the above closing date and time.
It will be the Supplier's responsibility to obtain any necessary documents in order to submit a response by the closing date and time.

The Contracting Authority reserves the right not to award any or part of the contract which is the subject of this Contract Notice and reserves the right to terminate the procurement process at any time.
The Contracting Authority will not be liable for any costs incurred by those expressing an interest in tendering for this contract opportunity.

The Contracting Authority will consider variant bids, evaluating them (so far as the variant or the evaluation of the variant is in the opinion of the Contracting Authority practicable) on the same basis as a conforming bid, but shall not be obliged to accept any such bid in preference to a conforming bid even if the variant bid scores more highly. No variant will be considered unless the bidder simultaneously submits a conforming bid.

ADDRESS_REVIEW_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: The Polesworth School and The Wilnecote School
